comments:
Component version: org.eclipse.osgi_3.3.0.v20070530.jar

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Create an OSGi bundle with a trailing comma in its Bundle-Classpath
2. Add an activator to that bundle.  The activator need not do anything; there must simply be a valid Bundle-Activator in the manifest.
3. When the bundle is activated, an NPE is thrown

The problem is easily avoided by removing the trailing comma.

More information:

osgi>
This is because BundleLoader#createClassLoader is returning null when the Bundle-ClassPath is invalid.  An error is published and logged but we should prevent the NPE here.

Created an attachment (id=72070)
patch

This patch causes malformed Bundle-ClassPath headers to fail to install.  I also added a check when the classloader is created to fallback to a default classpath ('.') if the classpath is invalid.  This last check is not really needed but the method createClassLoader is called all over the place and most callers do not expect null to ever be returned.  This change protects these callers.

Created an attachment (id=72073)
patch

Actually we should default to an empty String[] when classpath is invalid.
